public int mat_cols (  matrix    mat ) 
 

return number of columns of a matrix

Parameters:
mat  a matrix allocated by mat_alloc() whose column dimension we want to know
Returns:

public real mat_element (  matrix    mat,
int    row,
int    col
) 
 

return value of matrix element mat[row][col]

Parameters:
mat  the matrix whose value we want to set
row  value row offset
col  value column offset
Returns:
the value of the element.
Note:
if MAT_PARANOIA is defined, extra bound checking is performed and IEEE NaN returned on error.

public real* mat_row (  matrix    mat,
int    row_number
) 
 

return a row of a matrix

This function returns a pointer to the values of the specified row Ri(mat)

Parameters:
mat  a matrix allocated by mat_alloc
row_number  the index of the row to return
Returns:
a pointer to an array [1..dim] containing the row values

public real** mat_values (  matrix    mat ) 
 

return a (handy) pointer to the table of values of a matrix

Parameters:
mat  the matrix whose value table we want to access
Returns:
a 2D table with the values of the matrix arranged by rows and columns.
